result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus J Gonzalez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - is prepared to proceed to sentencing.  ADA concurs.  Court has received a letter.  ADA confirms receipt of letter and confirms compliance with victim rights.  ADA recites agreement.  Atty Privat makes sentencing statement.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

EACH CASE/COUNT:  

SWD and places the defendant on probation for 36 months

CONDITIONS:

Random drug and alcohol screenings per the agent
AODA - defendant is to continue with treatment
costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
14CF44 - 120 days county jail, stayed and is to be used by the agent.


14CF65 - defendant is eligible for 3 days of sentence credit if revoked.

Court adjourned at 10:23 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

2:29 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.  

ADA recites agreement - defendant plea to count 1 on 2014CF44 - dismiss count 2.  Defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CF65 - DRI count 2.  Agree not to charge a referral for bail jumping under14BPD1973.  Attorney Privat concurs - requests sentencing be held at a later date.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over the plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the two counts.  Court finds each plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2014CF44 and count 1 on 2014CF65.  Court DRI count 2 on 2014CF44 and count 2 on 2014CF65.  Court orders judgments of conviction be entered today.

Court directs both cases be set for Sentencing after the 1st of the year.

Court adjourned at 2:39 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 25, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

2:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, defendant has an additional charge and waiting on some information.  ADA concurs.  Court will set for plea & sentencing in 30 days.

Court adjourned at 2:02 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:49 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - requests an adjournment.  

Court directs Plea/Sentencing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m.
Status hearing on August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
for Discovery (Defendant's)
Defendant's Discovery Demand

2:40 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Barbara Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - waives preliminary hearing on 2014CF44 - if no waiver on 2014CF65, will be waiving also.

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing on both cases - defendant waives this right on both cases - court accepts the waivers and binds the defendant over for trial on both cases.

ADA files Informations with the Court and provides a copy of each to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Informations and waives reading on both.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on all counts in both cases.  Attorney Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant to all counts in both cases.  

Court directs both cases be set for Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:44 p.m.
By Atty Barbara Privat
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement w/attachment
Status hearing on July 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

3:05 p.m.  State by Special Prosecutor Chad Hendee.  Defendant present via video from Green Lake County Jail with Attorney Barbara Privat.

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $200.00 cash bond with the conditions of:    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Attorney Privat waives time limits as to the Preliminary Hearing.  Court directs Status Hearing be held on July 22, 2014 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:09 p.m.
